Yahushua loves you!
This is one of the first coconut oils I purchased.  I purchased it for my homemade hair and body butter concoctions.  It was/is a great product however, I have found a cheaper alternative.  Thanks
These sardines are top quality. They are small, beautifully packed, with a nice light smokey flavor. The olive oil packing liquid adds nicely to the flavor. It's certainly worth the premium price.

I bought mine at Whole Foods, and was excited at first, but no where on the package does it say that these colors do not work on eggs.  Okay, so reading their website it says these are not for eggs, fine, no more easter eggs, but what about coloring hard boiled eggs for kids' bentos?  Nope, the colors do not stick to a peeled egg either.  And it did not matter how much vinegar I used either.  Okay, so, moving on to frosting, no matter how much you add the frosting is always pastel, okay, fine, no real biggie, but the red comes out like a brick red color, really quite orangish, and I couldn't get a good a pink or purple because of it.  I guess I should have put the stuff in the fridge because it does not last well either.  I will definitely be looking for an alternative naturally colored food coloring, until then I am relegated to nothing more than using the blue to make the kids' scrambled eggs green a la Seuss.

I purchase this popcorn at Costco every chance I get. I was glad to see it at amazon for such a great price. This popcorn is always very good and fresh.
The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because my favorite cheese popcorn is a little more cheesy and stickier.

Although slightly more expensive per pound than the same brand from Costco (approximately a 1.2 pound pack vs. 1 pound for same price), these have very little odor, while same brand at Costco are very "aromatic". Our golden retriever likes both about equally. The chews seem to clean her teeth.

I cut the sticks in half on my band saw, so a 6" piece is about right for a good days chewing.

Fantastic coffee.  Here's my trouble -- and it's very likely that it is MY trouble alone: I don't know how to make a cup of good, strong coffee using these tea-bag sort of coffee packets and a regular coffee machine.  I find that if you put these packets into the bottom of the coffee filter basket and run water through it, the water runs through too fast and the coffee is too weak.  I have tried using these like actual teabags, which definitely makes a better cup of coffee, but requires a little more time and supervision than I want.  I presume that the right kind of machine, or the right style of coffeemaking, turns these packets into solid gold for ease of use; for me, though, not so much.  But yeah: seriously tasty coffee, once you get the right amount of coffee-ness in your hot water.
This is one of our favorites for a mild coffee.  It's very flavorful, but not strong or bitter, and complements food very well.
I LOVE this coffee.  It's strong and bold without a bitter aftertaste.  I have just placed an order for another one.
Worked ok, kind of a pain to keep squirting it over and over. Thinking an aerosol would have been better.

My wife and I go through jalapeno slices like they're water (we eat a lot of nachos and also include these in most everything else we cook: huevos rancheros, meat loaf, etc., etc.) and these are the best we've tried. Also, the unit price at Amazon is the best we've found for any brand of japapeno slices. That's why we're sad: the last time I went to order more, Amazon was out of stock, with no projected availability date. What are we to do??

I have persistent dry scalp so I'm always looking for products to help with this.  I use a tar based shampoo part of the time but don't want to use it daily.  The Clear Scalp and Hair shampoo works fine - my hair is clean, soft and my scalp is not itchy after using it.  But it has a perfume-y scent that I don't care for.  I will not be buying it again because of that.  Perhaps a scent-free shampoo could be developed?

This coconut oil is wonderful. I use it as the shortening in my bran muffins and then as a spread when I toast them. I also used it to fry yellow squash. The combination of flavors were awesome.
Even used it on my hair as the best hot oil treatment ever.
After reading the benefits of coconut oil, this product will be a staple in my household.

coffee is great but delivery was very slow. First time i ordered product came very fast. This time it took a week to arrived. This was very disappointing since I based my consumption on the first order. Do not know that I would order again.

I've been some combination of nursing and/or pregnant for a few years now, and trying to find time for a meal when chasing after a toddler or when morning sickness gives you many reasons to avoid every food on earth can be a real challenge. Because of this I sometimes feel like my pantry is some sort of test cabinet for a nutritional bar company. There are always at least a few kinds in there, ones that I've tried before and like and ones that I'm trying out for the first time. I finally got around to trying Kind Bars after all this time, and this specific flavor is officially on my "that's it, you've found a gold medal winner" list.

There's usually something for my picky side to take issue with, but not this time. I love that they have extra protein, as they really manage to leave me feeling full and satisfied if I end up turning to one in place of lunch. The fact that it was packed with nuts made me suspect that I would find it too crunchy, but it has the perfect level of chewiness with a really pleasing-but-not-overpowering crunch. Unlike their sister bars (Passion Fruit Macadamia + B Complex, which I purchased at the same time) these are not cloyingly sweet. Don't get me wrong, they have sweetness, but I find that it's just the right amount-- you're tasting the nuts and other good things with just a bump of sweetness to help it along.

I bought one box to try them out, now I'm back to load up on them while they are on sale. I'm going to be keeping these as my main bar with one or two other favorites for occasional variety. If you are the kind of person that is always on the lookout for a quick meal or snack fix, I really can't recommend this specific bar more!

My wife is Chinese and drinks this every day. She prefers the loose leaf type and this tea comes in a mylar type sealed bag inside the box. This keeps it very fresh until it's time to open a new box. The flavor is a mild traditional green tea.

I had a hard time drinking this tea as it tastes like cardboard! There's no taste or flavor. I don't know if it actually works to strengthen the uterus as I wasn't able to make myself have it for the couple of months required. I'm not sure if all raspberry tea tastes like this or just this brand.

I LOVE liquid smoke, so do most people after they've had my steak, chops or chicken; I've helped initiate more than a few fans. Last year my local store stopped carrying Wright's, but brought in 3 new brands to replace it. All three brands had soy in them and other various ingredients. Having only used Wright's in the past I was shocked to learn that not all liquid smokes are created equal. Wright's liquid smoke is allergen-free, which in my family is hugely important. I was delighted to find Wright's on Amazon, now I order by the case, save money and get the purest product on the market.

I found this in a coffee shop and was delightfully surprised.  this is the best coconut tea I have ever had.  Everyone that I give a tea bag to,  wants to buy it.  It is perfect by itself or with cream.  it has just a hint of cocoa - I found it to be more for coconut lovers than chocolate lovers - although my sister in law who is a chocolate nut loved this tea.  Hopefully Amazon will carry this soon because the coffee shop is gone and I am running low...!

I ordered this to serve at the Holidays and it was very well received.  It does not have a strong coffee taste - it's more of a cocoa flavor with a hint of coffee.  The instructions on this product instruct to make it with water, but it has a much richer taste if you make it with milk.  At any rate, it's a good product and I would recommend it.
Item tasted plain and was crumbly. Did not taste at all like it is described. We were disappointed with product.

Very delicious! The consistency of the cola gummi candy was more like concentrated than those of the gummi bears. It was not as soft but the flavors linger longer in the mouth. Love it and will order more in the future

Pomegranate: My first sip of Izze's Sparkling Pomegranate was not appreciated by my palate very much; I thought it tasted like someone had mixed a wine cooler with beer. I actually did a double take to look at the can and search for alcohol content. By the end of the can I liked it, and by the 3rd can I really liked it. It's tangy, fresh, with no sweet aftertaste and has a cool looking container design (aesthetics always matter!).

With a total of 80 calories per cute little can, this isn't exactly what you'd call a "diet drink," but I find it to be surprisingly filling, so it makes a great in-between liquid snack, and can stave away the hunger pangs until your next meal without doing damage to your diet.

Overall a nifty drink in a most attractive can. Don't let the first taste fool you. Izze's Pomegranate Fizzy is quite yummy...a very pleasurable acquired taste.
.......................................
Grapefruit: Izze's Sparkling grapefruit is absolutely the best drink in a can I have ever tasted. Nothing is even a close 2nd. Tangy and refreshing, its lemony grapefruit flavor is quite strong and tantalizing. It also contains white grape, apple and orange juice from concentrates, but what my taste buds remember most is the lemon and grapefruit. The Grapefruit flavor has 90 calories per can, for those counting calories, but like the Pomegranate, it's very filling, and does well as an "in-between" snack for dieters.

This wonderful Izze fizzy is addictive. On a hot day cold Sparkling Grapefruit is a total delight, and since it does not have refined sugars it truly takes away your thirst, not like those soda pop drinks that actually seem to make one thirstier. Thank you Izze, your Sparkling Grapefruit gets the gold award for canned beverage in my house.
If you're into "hard likker," Izze's Grapefruit would make the perfect mixer, for vodka or tequila.
I have just ordered this same product from Great Northern Popcorn website. It is about $30.00 cheaper than Amazon. Have not tried it yet so I don't know how it taste.

You get two small bones in a package NOT the large one show I have 2 15 lb dogs who ate them like candy in 5 minutes expected a LARGE single bone to be chewed on for a while NOT a 8 dollar snack to eat BEWARE

My dogs pretty much eat healthy snacks like dried chicken, dehydrated sweet potato sticks, fresh carrot sticks and the like. They turn their noses up at most store brand dog treats and bones, but they love these. One of my dogs has a very sensitive stomach, too, but has never had any issues with these. They're crunchy low-odor treats that make a great little snack. They're too big to use as a treat if you're going to be handing out multiple treats for a training session, though, and attempting to cut them will crack the outer crunchy shell.  In addition to the treats themselves, I love the 40 oz plastic jar. It keeps them fresh and is reusable. I once bought a box of these in the store that some creepy crawlies had gotten into, so I love that the plastic jar keeps the bugs out, too!

For the most part, these are what you'd want in pistachios. They arrive fresh and tasty, for a little lower price than the local store.

I'd estimate about 5-10% of the nuts are not opened, and get trashed. Another 10% get opened with some fingernail prying and pulling pretty hard.

They're pretty salty, which isn't ideal, but right where I'd expect a normal salted pistachio, great for some who like salty and too much for others.

However, there's one bug in the product - literally. I think two of the last three bage had one nut each where the nut had a bug - work, whatever it was - inside the shell.

If you're on the couch munching watching tv, not looking at the nuts you open and eat, it'd be very easy to have eaten it. It's disgusting.

I contacted the manufacturer, and they explained 'they try but it's not practical to avoid'. They're not the only brand - my last bag (and I mean last bag, over a year ago, didn't buy after) had the same thing.

This is a great bar for a meal replacement. The only problem is that he outside peanut-butter was sort of melted as it was being shipped and stored so the inside was a bit messy. The taste? Very good, no after taste, very filling and overall a tasty bar for protein and a meal replacement.

I love teavana products, when I ordered this sampler set I was excited. It arrived with NONE of the tea, I contacted customer service, They took their time sending me the teas I had already paid for, and four completely different flavors of teas arrived, the flavors look gross "strawberry lemonade" and other fruity flavors, but NONE of the teas they claim are included are here.This Not what I ordered, customer service leaves something to be desired, in my opinion they should have put a rush order on the teas they forgot to send me. Now I have tea I paid for and don't want. Very disappointed.
It is good. I prefer the taste of baking mixes from scratch, but for store bought, it's pretty good. Much cheaper in local grocery stores. Under $5 per box at my local stores in Chicagoland area.

I don't do very many reviews of products, but I had to for this to try and spare others like me. This is one of the most repulsive, vile and sickening "food" products I have ever had. I know nothing about their other flavors, but stay very far away from this. It tastes like someone took whiteboard chalk, ground it up, put it into a kiln with coffee bean shells and "roasted" them together until they were burned beyond recognition. I can't find the words to describe the awfulness of this product. So I'll try a different method to describe it... Some of you may be looking at these bars because they are vegan. If you are, trust me, you will be happier eating a slab of baby seal which you clubbed yourself while kicking puppies in the face. I truly wish there was a negative star rating. This product deserves it.
I love this salt, hardly have to use any its very salty thank goodness its healthy.  I never use table salt or sea salt anymore.

My honest opinion, beautiful, but strange tasting, and made me feel a little sick. They tasted good enough so that I ate five more quickly after eating the first, and did notice a melon flavor, but it seemed quickly muted by this odd sweet taste that made me feel ill. It wasn't highly unpleasant, but made it taste what I thought was overly candy like and so turned what could have tasted like something pleasant, into a cheap candy taste, that was too strong and so made me feel sick. Also the powdery consistency in the middle I don't think was strong enough, I noticed more of the soft outer covering than the filling, which was more interesting and so wanted to taste that more, but it was so easy to chew that it passed into me fast and was gone in a moment.

The regular cola flavor has a terrible diet taste.  I hate artificial sweeteners, just can't get used to the chemical taste. I just plain don't like it at all, and poured the rest of the syrup down the drain after using only enough for 1 bottle of soda.  Yep, it's that bad.
I like all of the flavors to a degree, except this one.  It's really salty and the combination of flavors isn't good.

I am a first time owner. I read that it is best to feed a puppy higher quality foods instead of the big commercial brands. After reading a lot of positive reviews, I decided to try Wellness Super5 for Puppies. Worst mistake I ever made. My little bully's stool was never firm. It did however make his coat very shiny. But he developed a very bad case of diarrhea. He stopped eating and drinking for a day. I was so worried about the lil guy. After an overnight stay (& a very expensive vet bill), my lil bully returned home full of energy. The vet recommened that he would have to eat canned Purina EN for the rest of his life. Realizing that they really just wanted my money, I decided to switch his food. I decided to go with Canadae ALS. During the transition, BlackJack was still having a loose stool. After more research, I finally decided on Cal Natural Lamb & Rice. I started mixing this food and BJ developed a very bad bloody diarrhea case. I started the "at home remedy" of pepto bismol and a bland diet. The pet store clerk recommended some canned pumpkin as well. BJ fasted for 24 hours. After feeding him boiled chicken & rice for a few days, the blood gradually disappeared. I slowly started mixing the Cal Natural Lamb & Rice. All i can say is BJ is feeling 100% better and his stool is solid!!! This was the result I wanted with Wellness, but I was very disappointed.

IF YOU WANT A HEALTHY PET AND A FEW BUCKS SAVED FROM A VET VISIT, PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS FOOD!

This stuff is pretty darned good for what it is...not supposed to be great for you but beats a big burger and fries. If you pair this up with a dark green salad and maybe a slice of garlic toast, you're good to go! I put red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese on top of mine and zipped it up a little. These Compleats meals are iffy--some are better than others. This one happens to be pretty good. I do wish they'd have made it with meat sauce, but as it is, it's good enough for me to recommend it to you. My kindergartener was licking her fork! So...

I love these chips.  Not only are they gluten-free, but they help me stay on my Weight-Watchers Points Plus program, too.  I can enjoy a whole bag of potato chips, get that crunchy craving satisfied while not feeling deprived or guilty.  Sometimes I wish they were a little saltier, but that's not a big problem.  I just add a little sea salt when that happens.  Most of the time, they are just perfect!  I have reordered these repeatedly since I was first introduced to them earlier this year.  What a find!  (I have also ordered directly from Glenny's website.  Amazon often beats the price with super-saver shipping, though.)

My dog never met a meal she didn't love including this one.  The price is very good, especially utilizing the subscription option.  I make 2/3 of the food I feed my dog, it's very easy and economical and the best way to control the quality.

Thought I was ordering Light roast of these K-cups.  When I received the box, it said light roast on box.  When I opened it, it was all Extra Bold French Roast....bleh!!  Too much trouble to return so I sent it w/ my husband to his office and bought some K-cups at the store.

I have been making pumpkin pies and other treats for years.  And I have noticed how over the years that Libbys Pumpkin has become less and less dense, no doubt to keep the pricing and profit margins at a certain point.  The problem is that I have to adjust my recipes so that the mix isn't so liquid.  I have also complained to Libbys to no avail -- they simply issue the typical corporate lie as if they're responding to a first time user.

If you have to have a lollipop these are pretty good ones to have. Natural. Organic. Free of most allergins(safe for most "allergy kids"). Great flavors (Mango, Pomagranite, Watermelon, Apple, Blueberry, Cherry, Grape). Colors from beets, carrots, berries, etc. Kids and adults love them. I have been using them for years at schools and public events, and people ask for them over every other major brand lollipop I try.

Very good option if you are looking for flax. It is very finely ground so if you want flax that is a little more coarse try another product.

Jacqui

I like this coffee alot, because I'm one who prefers a mild tasting vanilla rather than a flavor that's heavy or artificial. I took off one star due to the coffee being mild tasting as well. I was expecting Starbucks usual full bodied coffee...and it isn't. If you're looking for a richer coffee flavor, I'd try Melitta.

In lieu of the nearly mythical regard of this coffee according to our Amazon reviewers, I simply had to give this a go. Initial results are: good, but not as good as advertised. Allow me to elaborate: I LOVE COFFEE. This stuff does not taste like coffee, it tastes like flavored water. It lacks that fullness and bold flavor that I desire, which I guess is what you're getting when you get pecan flavored coffee.

TL;DR: If you like bold coffee, avoid at all costs. If you like "light" coffee, this is your blend. Either way, you'll like it, just maybe not as much as everyone implies.

I popped open a 1.5 Liter bad boy after a six-mile run and felt refreshed, but it was very hot and I don't know that the refreshment was from anything more than recovering from severe thirst. I drank the entire bottle in about 15 minutes.

I take other pre-workout and post-workout supplements and many of them have potassium and electrolytes. I noticed that a bottle of water from Wal-mart, bottled at a municipal plan, contains the same level of potassium as Essentia. I down a couple of 16.9 ounce bottles of that water after running as well.

So, I can't attest that this water will change your life. I can't even attest that it's worth more than other waters. pH balanced water sounds great, and there's really nothing from a taste level that's bad, certainly. But did it impact my overall physical recovery after a run? I don't think so. I was less thirsty, of course, but my legs didn't spring into action any faster or anything like that.

It's good water. Given a choice of this water or another brand that was similarly priced, I'd reach for this one. But I also didn't experience a compelling reason to switch from the cheaper Wal-mart water.

Claxton Dark Fruitcake has been a holiday tradition in our family since the mid 1950's. I ordered it directly from the company this year and when I served it at Thanksgiving, my guests and I thought I must have been fooled by a counterfeit website just claiming to sell Claxton fruitcakes. It was at best 40% fruits and nuts and consisted of a gummy light colored "cake". I emailed the company and expressed my disappointment. After several emails back and forth and after today talking to one of the owners, they assured me that it was the original dark recipe.

In reading the ingredients, I noticed that corn syrup, sugar and high fructose corn syrup were listed after flour which was the 4th ingredient. At the very end were listed molasses, spices and 3 artificial food dyes. High fructose corn syrup wasn't widely available until the mid 1970's to mid 1980's, so I'm not sure how it was one of the original ingredients.

All of the people I talked to seemed to have the attitude that I was so stupid that I couldn't possibly be observing what I had correctly. Although they offered to send replacements if I returned it at my own expense, they told me that what I would receive would be identical to what I have. One of the owners informed me that they had received zero complaints this year.

I am grieving the loss of an almost 55 year tradition, but the other 4 cakes are now in the trash.
Mmmmmmm...This sipping chocolate is heavenly. I used half and half to make it very rich and didn't add sweetener. Mmmmmm it is so good. Kelly. [...]

I LOVE this protien bar.  Best that I have EVER had.  Do not order in the summer.  I got them and they were totally melted, BAD.  I did find that by refrigerating them you could at least salvage the bar.

I bought this product to use in my tea. I normaly buy Honey granuals, but I decided to try this product instead. I used two teaspoons in my tea. What I got was no sweetness at all, no honey taste at all, and a load of sludge in the bottom of my cup, that when I accidently got a mouthful of it tasted like old cardboard. It was absolutly disgusting. To make it worse after I put it in my tea, I mixed it with the rest of my honey granuals in my container, so now I have to throw it all away. This product is straight up disgusting. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
I've been taking Cytomax for a few years now and I find it helpful in marathons and triathlons.  I would highly recommend the tropical fruit flavor.

My dog loves these treats.

My only complaint is that they should make some larger size ones.

I have a border collie/lab mix, about 75 pounds, and he just gulps these down.

We still give them to him, as they really do help his skin problems.

From our experience with other treats, if they were larger, he would chew them and enjoy them more.
As a newly adopter of a one year old, I tried certain foods with not much success.  My dog loves this food, and I do too, as she eats well and healthy.
as the rest...  Have been taking the product for over 3 weeks.  Didn't notice any improvement or change in anything, and it tastes AWFUL>

I tried this bar after trying the Bakery on Main PB & chocolate bar.  I liked this one a lot better.  The same issues with texture - better if it's warmed up a bit so it's more pliable.  But the flavor is good.  These do the trick when I need a GF granola bar fix.

Got these for a change of pace when it comes to packing my lunch for work. My usual fare is either an Easy Mac Bowl or a Lean Cuisine, so I wanted to try something like a Lean Cuisine that didn't require it to be kept frozen. Seemed like a good idea.

Firstly, it doesn't appear as though you get much. There was some penne pasta but it doesn't seem like much and it's really not. I guess for the amount of calories per serving it's fine, but I was still hungry after eating it. The sauce is a bit on the sour side. Now, being a born and bred italian, I despise sickly sweet pasta sauce one often finds as you move west through the country, but this was even too sour for me. The chunks of chicken were laughable, i probably wouldn't have even known it was chicken had I not been looking for them and ruled out every other piece of food I *could* identify. I almost would rather not have the chicken in there at all if it's just going to be little freeze dried cubes of mystery meat.

All in all, I was disappointed. Maybe another style/type of Lunch Express is better, but I don't think I'll be buying any more of the Tuscan Style Penne any time soon.

The Espresso roast is very smooth and very good. To be honest though, the dark roast has a much more pronounced flavor and is personally preferred over the espresso. Don't get me wrong, the espresso is worthy enough to buy again, but if you're going for "WAKE UP AND TASTE THE COFFEE" experience, the dark roast is the one you want.

Every 5lb bag of whole beans I've bought off of amazon has been tasty and worthy of 5 stars (even outside of subjective preference, they are GOOD coffees, if maybe roasted too dark or too light for my tastes, etc). This product defied that standard. The beans were dry and dusty. Many of them were broken into smaller pieces already, and the coffee brewed is distinctively "bad." I suspect that my 5lb bag may have been old stock, but it was a huge dissapointment. I soldiered through the last cup today and felt compelled to prevent others from making the same mistake I did. Go with something else.
Well worth the price and wait by mail!  Tastes like a waffle and not a pancake (I hate waffle batters that are just pancake batters).  Nice smell, texture and have no complaints.  G. Will

These are premium fresh organic beans resulting in great flavor after roasting on an air popcorn popper to a medium roast which is my preference.I roast small batches, outside and grind in about 48 hrs. With great results.

I've had my Kuerig for about 6 months now.  The hardest thing to do is find good, bold, strong coffee that can be used to make a 10oz mug of coffee.  Too many (most) K-Cups produce a watery-horrible 10oz mug but this cup stands up.  A mug of this coffee is still rich and bold.  I still lhave a hard time with how much K-Cups cost but when on sale this is a worthwhile coffee.

Interesting product. Overly hyped, high priced red raisins! This brand is comparable to others.  I doubt that they're grown in the Himalayas.  Goji is also grown in California.  I didn't think that this food is especially "super".
It is very cute. Once I put it in I had to take it off and take a hole puncher to a few spots bc it wouldn't fit exactly but it was close.

Do an Amazon search for "Easter", and what comes up, in addition to the nice Easter movies and such? A skinned dead rabbit. Are you people on crack?!!!! I'm sitting here browsing with my kids looking for a couple of Easter DVDs and this is what they see? Wake the hell up, Amazon!!!!

I've had my Kuerig for about 6 months now.  The hardest thing to do is find good, bold, strong coffee that can be used to make a 10oz mug of coffee.  Too many (most) K-Cups produce a watery-horrible 10oz mug but this cup stands up.  A mug of this coffee is still rich and bold.  I still lhave a hard time with how much K-Cups cost but when on sale this is a worthwhile coffee.
I'm glad to taste this one; it's ideal for me, not bitter. Taste is smooth, whether adding sugar/cream or black.  I'll order more.

My puppy is teething so I had previously purchased the original Nylabone made out of flavored plastic. The dog loved it, not super excited about the regular bone but she did put a lot of work into destroying it. When she finally finished the original plastic bone I decided to go back to the store and grab some more. I was looking around and came across these, "natural," flavored bones and thought.... "SWEET!!! Same great bone but easier to digest!" How wrong I was. First off this is NOTHING like the plastic teething bones. They crumble easily... and by easily I mean my 3.5 month old Wheaten Terrier destroyed these in less than 30min, and she's only about 15 pounds right now. They are recommended for dogs 6 months + with pretty much a full set of permanent teeth because they can shred the bone more easily and to a finer debris. For my dog this was BS... she destroyed these into tiny little flakes that can be easily digested AND managed to get them all over her underbelly and tangled in her fur. The mess wasn't an issue.. the durability was. This is basically an expensive treat, I much rather give her bullysticks over this as a treat (and they last longer). If your dog is teething, this is def NOT the Nylabone version you want. Stick to the original plastic flavored bones or frozen towels. Both work great.

My husband recently has had to go on a "no salt" diet, and his favorite restaurant is Outback, so I ordered him this steak seasoning.  The first time we used it, we both thought it was very bland - the steaks tasted like they had been cooked with nothing.  We doubled the amount we used the second time, and it was still completely tasteless.  The third time we dipped the steaks in egg and used this seasoning as a breadcrumb-style coating (nothing added to it, just a bowl of this seasoning), and the steaks were STILL completely tasteless.  I threw the rest of the giant tub of colored red flecks in the garbage.  Did I just get a really old batch or what?  What a waste.

I eat oatmeal for breakfast every day.  Nutritionally the Old Wessex brand is identical to Walmart's Great Value Old Fashioned Rolled Oats.  The price of the Old Wessex oats is $2.42 a pound and the Walmart oats cost $1.14 a pound.  So my yearly cost for Wessex is $106.50 and for Great Value it is $50.16.  Thus the Old Wessex oats cost $56.34 more per year.  The Old Wessex oats definitely taste better, no question about that.  But do I want to spend $56.34 more per year for the identical nutrition?  I don't choose to spend that extra money.

I bought the Walkers' Assorted Toffees, flavors included Banana Split (loved this one as I am a big fan of the flavor banana).
Milk Chocolate covered Toffee, which was good.
English Creamy Toffee, which was also good.
Chocolate Toffee, which was very good.
And,there was also Chocolate Eclair which was my favorite, toffee with a creamy chocolate in the middle, yummy!
The only downfall was that they had more of the Banana Split type candies than any of the other in the container.
Liked them so much I am buying them AGAIN! :)

I love this Chai Tea, i normally bought my chai tea from starbucks, but since we moved to the most northern town BARROW, AK, theres not such a thing.
I ordered this tea and it is even better than starbucks, i will order this tea soon again

I'm usually pretty busy during the day so taking time to eat lunch is a real stretch. since I'm on the Atkins diet this is the perfect substitute for a "sit-down" a serving is four packets- I usually have only two and that keeps me going until dinner. Professional packaging, clean wrapper, excellent product.

CELIACS, BEWARE!! I believe this rice is gluten-contaminated. I've tried it twice in the past year, and each time suffered a serious reaction (I have a very high level of sensitivity to gluten). The first time, in 2011, I wasn't sure if it was the rice or perhaps something else. So in 2012 I tried it once more, this time being very careful that there were no other foods that could influence the outcome. The reaction the second time was even worse.

I don't have any problems with Lundberg Bros. rice products or Tinkyada or Jovial brands of rice pasta.
I ordered this one and the salmon but I got two salmon instead. I bet this one would be good if I ever got it.
I love gummy bears and was glad to find halal gummies on Amazon.  The gummies are delicious.  My only annoyance is that they are all stuck together.
Very nice company to work with. My first shipment was damaged and they immediately overnighted me a new order.PG Tips 80 Tea Bags

My order came quickly,was properly wrapped. Very beautiful for the Christmas season.

I was very pleased with my order, and so was all my family and guest. I even ordered a second box. I am getting ready to order a third box to take to London, England.

Thanks awfully.

Dr. Winnie Payne.
We got 2 cats. 1 Siami and 1 Main Coon. Food is great and the cats like it. So what i have to say?

I have tried a lot of different coffees and this one is my all time favorite! the aroma when brewing is an instant wake up. The flavor is just as good as the smell. Not a strong coffee, but very flavorful, not bitter, nice finish, great!

Hubby and I both have teeth that can't handle anything too seedy or hard. I also lost 81 lbs (so far) doing a lower carb diet (not LOW, but LOWER). I pretty much skip bread these days--and cereal, etc--but I don't mind using up some of my starch/carb calories on these. So versatile. To dip. To make cracker sandwiches. To use breakfast type spreads on (when a craving for bagels/toast hits). I love them with hummus, with cheese, cracked over soup, topped with egg salad, with neufchatel and sugar-free preserves (I use Nature's Hollow). They are so nice to have with my breakfast omelettes.

Even my super picky hubby likes them. We both adore the texture. Oh, man. How perfect. The lightness that preserves a nice, gentle crispness.

Wasa, please don't ever stop making these.

I like this one and the mild rye. Both are now staples here. Satisfy my bread needs without a ton of carbs. And since I restrict myself to 1200 calories, two of these do little damage to my eating plan at 20 calories each. I also like to watch my sodium (middle-aged and almost off blood pressure meds), and these don't pack on the salt.

Thumbs up!

Now, if they could make one that's like an everything bagel--an everything crispbread light and crispy version with the onion/garlic/sesame seed/poppyseed. How cool would that be? (Or maybe they already have, dunno.)

Update: I don't eat gluten anymore, so I don't buy this product these days. For those who don't care about grains/gluten, I can still recommend it based on texture/taste/calories. But not for me as I'm trying to stay gluten-free. Be well...

I don't even like salmon without this stuff anymore. Yah, it has sugar in it, and spices, which means its amazing. When I'm out, I've even tried mixing a bag of sugar and my guesses as to what else went in there. Not as good =( Don't stop making this Mr. Prudhomme, I'm warning you.

Try chopping up a mango, half a peach, a tiny bit of bell pepper, throw in some cilantro, juice a lemon on top, drizzle some honey, dash of salt, and let marinade while your salmon is in the oven. Serve salsa on top, perfect mix of sweet and sour.

I order four of Natural Calm and I receive one only I have been calling regarding this order and I have no sollution to this situation. I hope they send me the rest of my order.

thanks.

Maria Irene Reyes

My ten pound Yorkie is very food centric when it comes to games - if there isn't food, he isn't playing. We have several bumble balls and kongs that he loves to play with and thought this treat wheel would be a fun new game for him. The yellow playing pieces were much too big for him to get his mouth around and he was unable to master using his paws to flip them out of the holders. For a dog that LOVES any game that involves food, this just proved much too frustrating for him. And believe me, we tried to help our little guy out with this. We left the yellow cups off and just slightly rotated the wheel, but even that was too difficult for him to "spin" as it did not move easily. And it's not like our dog isn't "Paw-centric" as he is actually quite adept at using his paws to move and flip his Kong, and to fish treats out from under furniture, etc. We tried over the course of several weeks to try and help our pal get the hang of this toy, but all parties finally agreed that this just wasn't fun the way a toy should be. Perhaps if you have a bigger dog this will work for you, but it received two paws down from our little buddy.

One other concern that I had was the fact that the small hole in the top of the yellow cups seemed just the right opening for a dog to catch a nail in and get stuck on his paw. Granted that on one should ever leave a pet and a toy unattended, but something for people to keep in mind if they do buy this product. (yes I'm a worry wart pet parent, but you'd be amazed at the predicaments our pets have gotten themselves into...)

We have 2 tomcats and this is the first time I've tried the Litter Pearls and I hate them and
the "boys" do too. They don't clump the waste in the litter tray and they don't cover it
either, not like the other brands, so you see most of their poop and it smells unlike
the other brands and it is so hard to clean up because the little
pearls roll everywhere when some spills out of the litter tray after the boys have been. Hate it
and will not ever use this again.

I enjoy these wintergreen flavored lifesavers. The flavor is refreshing without being too intense or overpowering. I also like the texture of these lifesavers. They are not as hard as conventional lifesavers; they have a softer texture, which is more enjoyable to chew as it crushes gently.

Each mint is individually wrapped, which make them perfect for sharing.

I usually have one to two after lunch and my breath feels fresh for the rest of the afternoon. A good choice of breath-fresheners!

These are the first gluten free crackers that I have ever tried, and they are alright if I have them with other stuff; however, I don't like eating them alone because there is a weird aftertaste. I think that I will probably either try a flavored variety or go back to my old fav rice crackers after I finish up what I have on hand...

One word, classic! My husband wont eat any other brand as they dont compare. These are perfection in a bag! It seems there is less salt than a few years ago which is fantastic but they still taste delish!

I was a little hesitant to try this...how could it possibly hope to imitate REAL peanut butter with any success? But, I love peanut butter but hate the calories, so I decided to take all the good reviews to heart and give it a go. I was honestly shocked when I mixed up my first tablespoons. It felt, looked, and smelled like real peanut butter! The taste is very close...obviously it's not going to taste exactly like real PB, but for the calories you are saving, it's surprisingly on target. Also, when you eat it with other things, as most people do, you don't even notice the difference. I spread it on toast and topped with honey...and it was SO delicious!!!

A 45-calorie serving is two tablespoons mixed with one tablespoon of water. Be warned, this makes quite a small amount of peanut butter. It is just enough to coat one slice of toast, and actually, I would like a tad more. So yes, this stuff is very expensive and you don't get very much.

Blue Diamond Bold Habanero BBQ Almonds are the absolute best....not to spicy yet not boring! Great way to get your daily dose of healthy fats into your diet!! They are fresh with the most amazing flavor. Blue Diamond has scored great on this flavor. I can not find them on my local grocery store shelves anymore so was delighted to see that I could still purchase them from Amazon.

Compared to popular brandd Peter Pan, Jiff, and Skippy regular creamy, the Planters creamy seems to have very comparable fat content as well as sugar and sodium contents. However, it only shows 4% iron, while the others had other vitamins listed, so compared to the others, this one has the least vitamin value.

It is by Kraft foods. I haven't noticed any amount of flowing oil in the container... just very spreadable peanut butter. It has very pleasant aroma, although I enjoy all the others as well.

Here is what it says on the label for those more meticulous about nutrition facts:
serving size 2 tbsp, servings about 14
Calories 180, Fat Cal 140
Per serving DV:
Total fat 23%
Cholest 0%
Sodium 5%
Total carb 3%
Protein 8g
Iron 4%

Ingredients: roasted peanuts, sugar, hydrogenated vegetable oil (rapeseed, cottonseed, and soybean oils), salt

Enjoy this whole pound (per canister) of peanut butter. :)

My first shipment of corn chips was rancid and absolutely inedible. That was very unfortunate because Garden of Eatin'chips can be very tasty. The Amazon vendor was no longer shipping so they were not replaced. I thought I was out the cost of a case of corn chips and still hungry.
But...........
Upon hearing my concern, Amazon found a vendor and sent a new shipment at their cost next day. Those chips are absolutely perfect! Amazon's responsiveness, service and customer care is exceptional! Thanks Amazon for a superb customer experience and for renewing my faith in Garden of Eaten' Blue Corn Chips!

We used to get the cookies here locally, but now are unable to find them.  My husband and I are both diabetic and we like sweet treats.  What a thrill to find these online.  I have enjoyed at least one or two a day since they arrived.  Yes, they taste really good.  I do wish they were a little less expensive, though.

good taste, not a strong salty taste .I make a mixture of this with grated onions about one tea spoon. and smother a saltine cracker with creme fraiche or cream cheese and spread the caviar over the top.

I'd never tried anything with soy intentionally and didn't realize this was soy milk. I'm not a gym goer, someone who exercises much or even a healthy eater. So why did I get this?

I need to cut down on my calorie intake. I tend to nibble during the day and have a big dinner, usually late because of work hours and then off to bed. This needs to change so I've started eating breakfast and lunch but decided I didn't need the crazy amount of calories at dinner time but did need something to tide me over until the morning.

This product is low calories (260 total for the whole 15.9 oz container) and high in protein (16g).

As for the taste...
Chocolate - very rich and thick, for me just a little too thick so I can't finish the whole container.
French vanilla - never liked french vanilla anything but I really like this.
Cappuccino - I was drinking cappuccino coffee multiple times a day - this doesn't thrill me that much, I thought it would be better but it's just OK.
Spiced Chai - I've never had Chai anything, I knew I was going to dislike this and oddly enough instead I really like it.

I do make sure it is cold, I think if any of these were on the warm side they would be a little less tasty.

*Update*
December 3, 2011 - With the exception of a once a week dinner out I've been having this in the evening after a salad loaded with veggies and fruits (fruit in the salad cuts down on the amount of dressing I need for some reason).

I decided to get on the scale, I am down 9 Lbs in just about 2 1/2 weeks. That's with no exercising.

French vanilla & Spiced Chai (the two I thought I wouldn't like) are my favorites.

*Update*
December 26, 011 - Well, goodbye 9 Lb weight loss. Didn't eat my typical salad and drink for dinner because of later holiday hours, parties and meetings and darn if I didn't gain back the 9 Lbs+. I'll be starting what I hope is a lifestyle change in the new year. I'm going to keep this drink for late night, try to eat dinner earlier and also make it a lighter meal. I'm also going for a max of 30 minutes a day of some kind of but light exercise so I don't get frustrated. Since I spend a ton of time driving and sitting at work, any exercise is an improvement.

One test I did make was I drank one of these a few times before those late nights, parties or dinners out and I definitely ate less because I was less hungry (high protein in the drink I assume) but I stopped drinking them because I was enjoying the holiday munchies too much.

My two kittens (6 & 7 Months) don't even think about eating these (Salmon flavor). I don't think they even recognize that they are food.

The good news is, after they leave them on the floor they come back later and play soccer with them, which they do enjoy (so thats why it gets 2 instead of one star).

(Bought at local pet store for about $1.50 more than amazon's price, for what its worth.

I have decided to try this based on good reviews. After about a week of taking it daily with a meal, I began experiencing severe, persistent stomach pains. I stopped taking the Maca, however I was still in pain for a few days after.

According to numerous accounts found on Google, Maca should NOT be eaten RAW, which is what this product is. Apparently the only way this is eaten in Peru is cooked or in gelatinized form.

As for the positive effects this is supposed to promote, I have not experienced any. This might be due to the short time I was taking this supplement, but again, the side effects prevented any extended use.

I purchased this item for my company's Mother's Day raffle based upon pictures and positive reviews. I was running out of time, had no time to shop myself and so Amazon was the solution. The item arrived damaged, not enough padding in the box, actually there was no padding at all. The contents arrived all closed in the box too, not nicely displayed as in the picture. The items were cheap dollar store type items, not worth 49 bucks!
I initially tried to return the item, only to get a response that this item is not eligible for return!! After calling Amazon, I learned I could still get a refund, but that they would not accept the product back since it contains some food items. I'm glad I got the credit back on my credit card, so I was able to get something else for this raffle instead. My recommendation, go to the local gift shop and check out your purchase directly. Do not get this item!

I gave this as a gift. I did not get to see the gift opened. Too bad. Once opened it was a HUGE hit not only by the recipient BUT by the entire party there. They all laughed. I was told the coffee was REALLY good as well
So, although I can not personally rate the items and the product, I can for surely say it was a homerun for sure

This is the "gift" of giving for me
Very cool to hear from others there.

I take this in the evening to help wind down, but feel its effects more in the morning when I ease into the cringing porcelain throne. I appreciate its nutritional value but would like to feel a bit more of the calm and a bit less of the avalanche.

I hate sport drinks. This one is different. It is beyond awesome. The taste is fantastic. The only way to buy it is by the case. Or it is very expensive. it is not cheap, but worth it.
I used to drink 6 to 12 diet cokes a day, no more.

My Vizsla puppy was given this toy and had absolutely no interest in it. But that is not even why this Toy is junk.
One afternoon in an attempt to get him to play with it, I tossed it towards him and the bone literally smashed into pieces. The only part salvaged from this toy was the rubber ball center. Which I now occasionally fill with peanut butter and he really love that. What a complete waste of money, it lasted one week. And he never even played with it.

Just a Note to tell everyone that the  4 LB.Variety comes in BOXES ..NOT BAGS!! I received a jar of Fire Balls as a gift and it made me realize how much I like them....so I ordered some more. These are not that hot. It takes several minutes in your mouth to get any cinnamon/fire flavor. You can also bite these and they crumble...

I wouldn't buy these again.

I really enjoyed this product. It tastes good and really gives you energy throughout the morning. I gave it 4 stars because it is not the best tasting granola on the market but it is a good product at that price point.

I thought I was getting a good deal on this water. I love it so much, and I'm trying to get into the habit of drinking water. I've never seen bottles this small of any kind of water. The smallest size in the store is around $1 per bottle. I misread the label while trying to figure out what size the bottles were for the purchase, and I feel stupid. A case is too heavy for me to carry home from the store, so I thought I'd check my trusty Amazon. I will have to come up with something else. I'd return this water, but the mistake is mine. Still, I'm baffled that someone would charge this much for water. (This review is for the 11.15-ounce size of Fiji Water.)

I gave this item as a gift and the recipient has not yet made the dish for which I gave it to her (a Foie Gras dish). But I must say this price for a French truffle is amazing. I suspect most of us do not have the palates to appreciate the $300 truffles. Good for those of you who do. But for the rest of us, this is a good choice.
Linda Morse
I ordered what I thought was the Original Stride Forever Fruit as what the picture showed.  What I got was the 2.0 which is terrible and not even close to the original gum.  Will be returning ASAP

Couple of years ago a friend of mine gave me some lichee tea that he brought from China. That tea tasted absolutely wonderful, so when I ran out of it I decided to get it from Amazon. Unfortunately I couldn't find the exact same tea, but I figured that lichee tea from china shouldn't be that different from one another, so I ordered Golden Sail brand Lichee Black Tea. Well... what can I say? the difference is huge. This tea is by no means the real thing. It is a decent black tea and I'll drink it, but it's more on the bland side, it has nothing of the wonderful aroma and sweetness of the lichee tea that I had before.
I was so happy to find this tea.  It is our favorite and the price is better than anywhere!  We have completely quit drinking soda- this is cheaper and healthier!
A good strong coffee for those who aren't shy about flavor.  Great for morning.  Wakes you up without caffeine. I'd buy it again.
Kind bars are one of my favorites! This box did not disappoint and my husband ate the majority.  My favorite is the apricot flavor

The Greenies Pill Pockets are the first product that has effectively worked in getting my dogs to take their medications.  They actually look forward to this treat and make it a painless process rather than the difficult process it was in the past.

El Yucateco makes a bangin' sauce. It's fairly thick and sticks well to food (not too runny). It's sweet, and it's got a little bit of kick to it. I'd give it a 4/10 for heat, a 7 or 8 for flavor.

My only issue is that it only tastes good on Mexican food. I've tried it on pizza and eggs (staple hot sauce foods for me) and I was left disappointed. But on a taco? This hits the spot.

For crying out loud you giant nimrods leaving stupid reviews, this is NOT cocoa powder to make hot chocolate with!  This is cacao powder, the crushed raw bean.  This is used to make raw chocolate and other delectables. If you are dumb enough to not know what you are ordering, you have no one but yourself to blame.

You cant go wrong with greenies! My dogs love them and go nuts on them. Only downside to this is that its so soft it gets chewed up quickly so i dont quite see how this will improve the dogs teeth and gums.

Amazon has the best prices by far and with no tax + amazon prime, this by far, becomes the cheapest place to buy products.
yum I haven't had these for years, they were actually fresh and not old blow pops like some I have bought before. good price too

I was somewhat in the dumps today because I am on a diet and I was feeling deprived, so I JUST NOW decided to try this drink on a whim and I finished my whole bottle. I looked up on Amazon to see if there were reviews for this product and other folks were saying that it was ineffective. And initally I was going to say the same thing, but right before I was clicking on 1 star to review the product, this "warm & fuzzy" feeling came over me, definitely not BLISSFULL, but warm and fuzzy. (and I bet people are already thinking to themselves "yea yea, you probably work for the company") but I don't...I can't prove it...but I don't.
